events.message: The insured reported that their car was involved in a collision with another vehicle at an intersection on April 9th.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and involved vehicle details.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation and processing of this accident.
Acknowledgement of claim receipt was sent to the insured, confirming that the accident report is being processed.
The insured was requested to submit police reports, photos of vehicle damage, and witness statements for further review.
The insured provided all requested documentation including pictures of the damaged vehicle and official police report.
An adjuster began the investigation process including contacting witnesses and assessing damage severity.
Investigation concluded with sufficient evidence confirming that the other party was at fault in the collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured covering vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the clarity and timeliness of the claims process and proposed settlement.
The claim was officially approved confirming coverage for the full amount of the proposed settlement.
Payment was issued to the insured's repair shop to cover the approved vehicle damage repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and payment received.
All documents and correspondence related to this auto accident claim were archived for record keeping.
